title: RL30877
content: This report addresses the differences among the tax-exempt organizations described in Internal Revenue Code subsections 501(c)(3), 501(c)(4), 501(c)(5), 501(c)(6), and section 527âcharitable organizations, social welfare organizations, labor unions, trade associations, and political organizations, respectively. Each type of organization has a unique statutory definition, enjoys benefits from obtaining tax-exempt status, is subject to statutory limitations on its activities, and must disclose certain information to the IRS and the general public. At the end of the report is a chart that summarizes the organizations' characteristics and reporting requirements.
